sentences.english: Walruses have enormous appetites and hunt for food almost constantly.
sentences.chinese: 海象食欲极大，几乎一直在猎取食物。

sentences.english: They lived in caves, hunted animals and gathered fruit.
sentences.chinese: 他们住在山洞里，猎取野兽，采集果子。

sentences.english: Suddenly I have got the idea, to hunt rabbits in the woods.
sentences.chinese: 突然，我有了这个想法，去林子里去猎取野兔子。

sentences.english: I have not wronged you, but you are hunting me down to take my life.
sentences.chinese: 你虽然猎取我的命，我却没有得罪你。

sentences.english: No squirrels are known to hunt vertebrates, or even scavenge meat.
sentences.chinese: 没有发现有松鼠猎取脊椎动物，或者以肉为食。

sentences.english: When you illegally take a trophy deer in Ohio.
sentences.chinese: 当你在俄亥俄州非法猎取奖榜级鹿的时候。

sentences.english: Polar bears only hunt from ice platforms at sea.
sentences.chinese: 北极熊只能在海面的冰床上猎取食物。

sentences.english: If the trapped pressure bleeds off the unloader will cycle, or hunt.
sentences.chinese: 减压器补集到的压力会再循环，或叫做“猎取”。

sentences.english: In this case, the poopers are pelicans.
sentences.chinese: 这是鹈鹕在水面上猎取鱼类的画面。

sentences.english: The Plains Indian has a plentiful and regular supply of meat and skins by the communal buffalo hunting.
sentences.chinese: 大草原的印第安人猎取公有的牛而常得到很多肉和皮。

sentences.english: Will ye hunt the souls of my people, and will ye save the souls alive that come unto you?
sentences.chinese: 难道你们要猎取我百姓的性命，为利己将人救活吗。

sentences.english: Inhabitants of the area also hunted whitetailed deer and the cottontail rabbit.
sentences.chinese: 这个地区的居民也猎取白尾鹿和白尾棕色兔。

sentences.english: And it is this high price that has led to the spread of shark finning.
sentences.chinese: 正是这种高价导致了猎取鱼翅的行为激增。

sentences.english: Hunting caribou is the way of life of the Gwich'in.
sentences.chinese: 猎取驯鹿是哥威迅人的生存方法。

sentences.english: They hunt game with spears or a curved wooden boomerang.
sentences.chinese: 他们用长矛或木制曲形飞镖猎取野味。

sentences.english: Primitive man hunted wild animals with crude stone implements.
sentences.chinese: 原始社会的人用粗糙的石器猎取野兽。

definition: to hunt and kill (an animal or fish)
to prey on/to catch and feed on/to hunt for food
to keep (an animal)/to look after the needs of (a person or an animal)/(fig.) to keep (a spy, lackey etc) in one's pay
